official_summary: The Republic of South Africa is one, sovereign, democratic state founded on the values of human dignity, the achievement of equality and the advancement of human rights and freedoms.
plain_language: South Africa is a single country with one government. It is a democracy where everyone has equal rights and human dignity is respected.

official_summary: The Bill of Rights is a cornerstone of democracy in South Africa. It enshrines the rights of all people in the country and affirms the democratic values of human dignity, equality and freedom.
plain_language: The Bill of Rights protects everyone's freedoms and rights. It includes freedom of speech, religion, and assembly, protection from discrimination, and many other fundamental rights.

official_summary: Everyone has the right to freedom and security of the person, which includes the right not to be tortured in any way and not to be treated or punished in a cruel, inhuman or degrading way.
plain_language: You have the right to be safe and free from torture, cruel treatment, or degrading punishment. Your body and mind should be respected and protected.

official_summary: Everyone has the right to freedom of conscience, religion, thought, belief, opinion and expression, including freedom of the press and other media of communication.
plain_language: You can believe what you want, practice your religion, think for yourself, and express your opinions freely. The media also has freedom to report and communicate.
